job_details.Functieomschrijving:
You'll be working on a search engine that serves both journalists and customers of DPG Media, across all media offerings. The company and your team members will actively support you to grow your skills and expertise. The search team consists of three developers, two based in Amsterdam and another in Antwerp. This is who you will be working with on a daily basis. Furthermore, the search team is part of a

   larger Recommendation & Search area consisting of approximately 20 engineers, a single manager and two product owners, in the Netherlands and Belgium. We work with an agile philosophy and on a flexible working regime. While most colleagues work from home, we like to get together in the offices regularly. You will be supported by a platform engineering team that manages the CICD pipelines, Machine

   Learning workflows and most of the infrastructure. This team is tasked with enabling the success of and synergies between the application teams.

     * Maintain and extend our search back-end.
     * Design, develop, run and evaluate online AB-tests to improve the quality of the search results.
     * Support operational excellence through practices like code review and pair programming
     * The entire team is responsible for the operations of our services. This includes actively monitoring different applications and their infrastructure as well as intervening to solve operational problems whenever they arise.
     * Keep up with developments in the field of Information Retrieval (e.g. semantic search).
     * Build RAG solutions for editorial domain

   Technologies
     * AWS, Kafka, Elasticsearch, Python (FastAPI), SQL, Docker
     * Nice to have: vector databases, semantic search
job_details.full_text:
Software Engineer

You'll be working on a search engine that serves both journalists and customers of DPG Media, across all media offerings. The company and your team members will actively support you to grow your skills and expertise. The search team consists of three developers, two based in Amsterdam and another in Antwerp. This is who you will be working with on a daily basis. Furthermore, the search team is part of a

   larger Recommendation & Search area consisting of approximately 20 engineers, a single manager and two product owners, in the Netherlands and Belgium. We work with an agile philosophy and on a flexible working regime. While most colleagues work from home, we like to get together in the offices regularly. You will be supported by a platform engineering team that manages the CICD pipelines, Machine

   Learning workflows and most of the infrastructure. This team is tasked with enabling the success of and synergies between the application teams.

     * Maintain and extend our search back-end.
     * Design, develop, run and evaluate online AB-tests to improve the quality of the search results.
     * Support operational excellence through practices like code review and pair programming
     * The entire team is responsible for the operations of our services. This includes actively monitoring different applications and their infrastructure as well as intervening to solve operational problems whenever they arise.
     * Keep up with developments in the field of Information Retrieval (e.g. semantic search).
     * Build RAG solutions for editorial domain

   Technologies
     * AWS, Kafka, Elasticsearch, Python (FastAPI), SQL, Docker
     * Nice to have: vector databases, semantic search

profile_classification.rationale: The job description emphasizes building RAG solutions, keeping up with developments in semantic search, and mentions vector databases as a 'nice to have'. While it involves software development and operations, the core focus on generative AI applications (RAG) and advanced search techniques like semantic search aligns best with the GenAI Engineer profile. The mention of 'Machine Learning workflows' managed by a platform team also supports this, as GenAI engineers often leverage these for their models.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves maintaining and extending a search back-end, designing, developing, running, and evaluating online A/B tests, and building RAG solutions. These are all core software development activities focused on building and improving user-facing applications or services.
job_tasks.phrase: Maintain and extend our search back-end

job_tasks.justification: Designing, developing, running, and evaluating online A/B tests is a direct software development task aimed at improving product quality.
job_tasks.phrase: Design, develop, run and evaluate online AB-tests to improve the quality of the search results

job_tasks.justification: Supporting operational excellence through code review and pair programming, and being responsible for the operations of services including monitoring and intervening to solve operational problems, are key aspects of operations engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: Support operational excellence through practices like code review and pair programming

job_tasks.justification: The entire team's responsibility for operations, including monitoring applications and infrastructure and solving operational problems, falls under operations engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: The entire team is responsible for the operations of our services. This includes actively monitoring different applications and their infrastructure as well as intervening to solve operational problems whenever they arise.

job_tasks.justification: Keeping up with developments in Information Retrieval, specifically semantic search, and building RAG solutions directly relates to the modeling aspect of generative AI and advanced search techniques.
job_tasks.phrase: Keep up with developments in the field of Information Retrieval (e.g. semantic search)

job_tasks.justification: Building RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) solutions is a core task within generative AI modeling.
job_tasks.phrase: Build RAG solutions for editorial domain

job_tasks.justification: Working on a search engine that serves journalists and customers across all media offerings implies understanding the business context and user needs.
job_tasks.phrase: You'll be working on a search engine that serves both journalists and customers of DPG Media, across all media offerings.

soft_skills.phrase: The company and your team members will actively support you to grow your skills and expertise.
The search team consists of three developers, two based in Amsterdam and another in Antwerp. This is who you will be working with on a daily basis.
The entire team is responsible for the operations of our services.
Keep up with developments in the field of Information Retrieval (e.g. semantic search).
